sk.turist.data

Class DBAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.turist.data.DBAdapter

  • public class DBAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    DBAdapter is database layer class represents interface between SQLiteDBS and application logic. A DBAdapter object encapsulates:
    • SQLiteDatabase db
    • DatabaseHelper DBHelper
    • Context my_context
    Author:
    Peter Vrana

    • Method Detail

      • createDataBase

        public void createDataBase()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Method creates SQLiteDatabase in android device and copy reqired data from database saved in assets. Method calls:
        • DBHelper.getReadableDatabase()
        • copyDataBase()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper#getReadableDatabase()

      • open

        public DBAdapter open()
               throws SQLException
        Open SQLiteDatabase.
        Returns:
        DBAdapter
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • close

        public void close()
        Close SQLiteDatabase.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • insertPlace

        public long insertPlace(java.lang.String date,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String region,
               java.lang.String coordinates,
               int height)
        Insert new record in SQLiteDBS - not used.
        Parameters:
        date - - Date of visitation of landmark.
        description - - Description of landmark.
        name - - Name of landmark
        region - - Region where is landmark situated
        coordinates - - GPS coordinates of landmark
        height - - Altitude of landmark
        Returns:
        Id of new record.
        See Also:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase#insert(String, String, ContentValues)

      • deletePlace

        public boolean deletePlace(long rowId)
        Delete record from SQLiteDBS with id = rowId - not used.
        Parameters:
        rowId -
        Returns:
        If any record was deleted method returns true else return false.
        See Also:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase#delete(String, String, String[])

      • getAllPlaces

        public Cursor getAllPlaces()
        Method load all places from SQLiteDBS.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.
        See Also:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase#query(String, String[], String, String[], String, String, String, String)

      • getIDS

        public Cursor getIDS(java.lang.String region_name)
        Method load IDS of landmarks which are situated in Region
        Parameters:
        region_name - - Name of region where are landmarks situated
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

      • getPlace

        public Cursor getPlace(long rowId)
                throws SQLException
        Method load landmark with id = rowid
        Parameters:
        rowId - - id of required landmark
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • updateContact

        public boolean updateContact(long rowId,
                    java.lang.String date,
                    java.lang.String description,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String region,
                    java.lang.String coordinates,
                    java.lang.String height,
                    java.lang.String path,
                    int region_id)
        Update place with new information, mainly date of visitation and absolute path to photo image from trip
        Parameters:
        rowId - - id of record in DBS
        date - - date of visitation or null if not visited
        description - - description of landmark
        name - - name of landmark
        region - - district where the landmark is situated
        coordinates - - gps coordiates of landmark
        height - - altitude of landmark
        path - - absolute path to photo image from trip
        region_id - - foreign key to table regions:
        • 1 - Žilinský
        • 2 - Košický
        • 3 - Prešovský
        • 4 - Bratislavský
        • 5 - Trnavský
        • 6 - Nitriansky
        • 7 - Trenèiansky
        • 8 - Bánsko Bystrický
        Returns:
        The number of rows affected
        See Also:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase#update(String, ContentValues, String, String[])
